body:
>adding a "fix this" button 

That seems like a really weird way to solve the issue. If we have a button that 'fixes' everything, why don't we just automatically do that for the user?

Currently, we're building roadblocks into the system where there doesn't need to be any, and forcing the user to think/act more than is required. Is there an argument _against_ always trimming strings?
